resources.string:
Subcore is a daemon that systematically monitors various data from your system to optimize your device for each unique workload. The goal is to conserve power that would otherwise be wasted on basic tasks that don't require the extra power (such as social media). This algorithm provides outstanding battery life at a marginal cost. 

Subcore monitors and optimizes multiple aspects of the system, including: 
- sysctl (kernel) tweaks 
- block (storage) tweaks 
- mm (memory) tweaks 
- CPU tweaks 
- GPU tweaks 
- scheduler tweaks 
- screen state 
- battery state and capacity 
- and much more 

What's more is that Subcore will generate profiles that are unique to the device based on its hardware specifications, including RAM size, battery life, max CPU frequency, max GPU frequency, CPU governor, and much more. This ensures each device is optimized to its full potential. 

Thank you for using Subcore and supporting me and my hobby. Contact me for criticism, compliments, concerns, or anything else!
